abstract.text: Called when an extension context requests permissions.

legalNotices.copyright: Copyright © 2025 Apple Inc. All rights reserved.

inlineContent.text: The web extension controller that is managing the extension.
The set of permissions being requested by the extension.
The tab in which the extension is running, or \c nil if the request is not specific to a tab.
The context in which the web extension is running.
A block to be called with the set of allowed permissions and an optional expiration date.

This method should be implemented by the app to prompt the user for permission and call the completion handler with the set of permissions that were granted and an optional expiration date. If not implemented or the completion handler is not called within a reasonable amount of time, the request is assumed to have been denied. The expiration date can be used to specify when the permissions expire. If
, permissions are assumed to not expire.

abstract.text: Integrate web content seamlessly into your app, and customize content interactions to meet your app’s needs.
An object that encapsulates a web extension’s resources that the manifest file defines.
Constants for specifying permission in a
An object that represents the runtime environment for a web extension.
An object that manages a set of loaded extension contexts.
A group of methods you use to customize web extension interactions.
Called when an extension context requests permissions.
A protocol with methods that represent a tab to web extensions.
A specific point in time, independent of any calendar or time zone.
A singleton actor whose executor is equivalent to the main dispatch queue.
An unordered collection of unique elements.
The return type of functions that don’t explicitly specify a return type, that is, an empty tuple `()`.
